ReportSection.name: Instructions
ReportSection.title: EPIC Conference (2025)
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL, Canada’s AgeTech network, is dedicated to the creation of technologies and services that benefit older adults and caregivers. Our mission is to help older Canadians maintain their independence, health and quality of life through technologies, programs and services that increase their safety, support their independent living, and enhance their social participation.

AGE-WELL has identified 8 Challenge Areas – difficult and complex problem areas found through extensive public consultation – that demand innovation and deployment of real-world solutions. EPIC Conference (2025) provides a unique platform for AGE-WELL and EPIC-AT students, postdoctoral fellows, research staff and ECRs to present their research alongside their stakeholder partners. It is an opportunity to showcase thepotential impact of this work while connecting with colleagues from around the world. Each session will also feature a segment called Moving the Dial that highlights how AGE-WELL partners and supported startups are improving quality of life for older adults and caregivers across Canada.

Interested AGE-WELL HQP and EPIC-AT Fellows are asked to submit an application that includes:
  • a presentation abstract
  • a co-presenter who is an older adult, caregiver, community, or industry partner in their research. Only applications that include a stakeholder co-presenter will be considered.

Note: Resources to help you to recruit, prepare and work with a co-presenter are forthcoming! Please do reach out to training@agewell-nce.ca if you need support.

HQP/EPIC-AT Fellow Presentation
All sessions will be hosted on Zoom and comprise of an introduction to the Challenge Area by the session Chair, live presentations from HQP / EPIC-AT Fellows and their stakeholder partners, and a Moving the Dial presentation that features an AGE-WELL start-up or partner. Q&A will follow each of the presentations.

Presenters are required to accompany their 10-minute talks with a presentation of 10 slides maximum (inclusive of title slide and bibliography). They are also required to co-present alongside a stakeholder in their research. For example, this stakeholder may be an older adult or caregiver with lived experience, an industry or community partner, or government decision-maker.

Check out the EPIC Conference 2024 presentations and workshops here.

Call for Abstracts
Presentation proposals are invited from all AGE-WELL HQP and EPIC-AT Fellows including alumni. Applicants are encouraged to review the full challenge area booklet here and ensure they are available for their sessions on the dates below. Applicants may also wish to review Co-presenting tips: How to deliver an engaging and cohesive presentation

Applications will be open in Forum from January 30 to March 21, 2025.

Please note that the information provided here will not be shared. It will not be used to adjudicate applications and will not affect your ranking. This information is solely collected so the platform can monitor the equity performance of programs and design new measures that achieve greater equity, diversity and inclusion in the research enterprise.

All applications for the EPIC Conference require you to complete a self-identification form; however, if you would prefer not to self-identify and/or provide the requested information, you may select “I prefer not to answer" for any or all of the questions.

Any self-identification statistics shared will always be reported in aggregate form to ensure protection of the identity of any individual.

The collection of this information is an essential part of efforts to improve EDI in science and research. For further information, please see the Tri-Agency's policy on Self-Identification Data Collection in Support of EDI and Canada's 50-30 Challenge.
